task.title: Setting snap spacing
task.shortdesc: Another way to ensure drawing accuracy is to turn on and set snap spacing. When snap is turned on, the program restricts the selection points to predetermined snap intervals. Although it is often helpful for snapping by means of matching the snap spacing with grid spacing, the setting is not required.

context.p: To turn snap settings on and set snap spacing

step.cmd: Choose Tools > Drafting Settings from the main menu.
Under Snap tab, input a value in the Snap X Spacing field and Snap Y Spacing field separately.

result.p: Status bar Right-click on the Snap Mode button to choose Settings.
TIP To toggle snap settings on and off at any time, click the Snap Mode button on the status bar, or press F9.
